intro: Gilia filifolia var. typica, commonly known as the threadleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia filifolia var. typica is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along stream banks.
